name: Christiansborg Palace
description: Christiansborg Palace, located on Slotsholmen in Copenhagen, is a historical landmark that stands on the site of Bishop Absalon’s 12th-century fortress ruins. It serves as the seat of the Danish Parliament, the Prime Minister's Office, and the Supreme Court of Denmark. The palace is a unique blend of history and modern-day governance, offering visitors a glimpse into Denmark's rich past and its current political landscape.

name: Kongens Have (Rosenborg Castle Gardens)
description: Kongens Have, also known as Rosenborg Castle Gardens, is Copenhagen’s oldest public park. It features formal parterres, lime-tree alleés, and is a tranquil space amidst the bustling city. The park is home to the beautiful Rosenborg Castle and offers a serene environment with benches to relax and enjoy the surroundings.

name: Botanisk Have (The Botanical Garden)
description: The Botanical Garden is an urban oasis in Copenhagen, featuring Denmark's largest collection of living plants. It offers a serene environment with rare and exotic species, complemented by the garden's historic moat and winding water features. Located just a few steps from Nørreport Station, it serves as a free public green space for visitors to roam and relax.

location.name: Botanisk Have (The Botanical Garden)
location.address: A few steps from Nørreport Station, Copenhagen, Denmark

name: Østre Anlæg Park
description: Østre Anlæg Park is a picturesque park in the heart of Copenhagen, Denmark, featuring sinuous pathways and water features atop 17th-century ramparts. The park is home to two playgrounds and one of the city’s popular toboggan runs. It also hosts the Hirschsprung Collection and SMK – the National Gallery of Denmark, which display world-class art.

location.name: Østre Anlæg Park
location.address: Accessible from Sølvgade, Stockholmsgade, Dag Hammerskjolds Allé and Øster Voldgade, Copenhagen, Denmark

name: Kastellet
description: Kastellet is a star-shaped citadel and verdant public park with military ramparts, located in Copenhagen. It is a well-preserved fortification that offers visitors a glimpse into Denmark's military history while providing a serene environment for walking and relaxation.

name: Statens Museum for Kunst
description: Denmark’s largest art museum, Statens Museum for Kunst, houses an extensive collection of Nordic Golden-Age paintings and European Old Masters. It is located in Østre Anlæg park and offers a rich cultural experience with its diverse exhibitions and art collections.

name: Ordrupgaard
description: Ordrupgaard is a museum that houses an impressive collection of French Impressionist and Danish Golden-Age works. It offers visitors a chance to explore both permanent and temporary exhibitions, as well as the renowned Finn Juhl's House and an art park.

name: Hirschsprung Collection
description: The Hirschsprung Collection is an intimate gallery located in the center of Copenhagen, showcasing Danish masterpieces. It is a popular art museum for art lovers, offering a rich collection of works by Danish artists.

location.name: Hirschsprung Collection
location.address: Located in the center of Copenhagen

name: Danish Museum of Art & Design
description: Designmuseum Danmark offers displays of decorative art, crafts, and industrial designs from the Western world and Asia. The museum showcases Danish creativity across furniture, fashion, and ceramics. It is housed in the historic Royal Frederik's Hospital, where Søren Kierkegaard was admitted and died in 1855. The museum features both permanent and temporary exhibitions, with contributions from internationally acclaimed Danish designers such as Poul Henningsen, Kaare Klint, and Arne Jacobsen. The museum shop offers a variety of Danish industrial designs, ceramics, glass, and fabrics, and the café provides outdoor seating in the beautiful Grønnegård courtyard during summer.

name: Louisiana Museum of Modern Art
description: The Louisiana Museum of Modern Art is a renowned coastal venue located near Copenhagen, featuring a comprehensive collection of Nordic and international modern art. It is celebrated for its unique blend of art, architecture, and landscape, offering visitors a serene and inspiring experience.

name: Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek
description: Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek is renowned for its winter garden and classical sculpture halls. It houses an extensive collection of ancient and modern art, including works from the Mediterranean, Danish Golden Age, and French Impressionism.

name: National Museum of Denmark
description: The National Museum of Denmark is the primary cultural-history institution in Denmark, showcasing a vast collection of Viking and medieval artifacts. It offers a comprehensive insight into the history and culture of Denmark and its people.

name: Puk
description: Restaurant Puk is a historic dining establishment in Copenhagen, offering traditional Danish cuisine with a focus on pickled herring. It has been in operation since 1750, providing a cozy atmosphere and a taste of Danish culinary heritage.

name: Broens Gadekøkken
description: Broens Gadekøkken, also known as Broens Street Food, is a vibrant harbor-front market located by the Inner Harbour Bridge between Christianshavn and Nyhavn in Copenhagen. It offers a diverse selection of Danish and global street food stalls, with an emphasis on organic ingredients. The market features popular vendors such as California Kitchen, GRØD, Gasoline Grill, Pizza Bro, Kejser Sausage, Dhaba, Haddock’s, Palægade, Will at the Bridge, MAC-CIK by IBU, and Barabba. Throughout the season, guest chefs from around the world are invited to showcase their unique takes on street food. The market also hosts events like Bar & Bølger, focusing on drinks and free samples, providing a lively atmosphere with stunning views over the water.

name: Reffen
description: Reffen is Copenhagen’s largest street-food hall, located in the vibrant area of Refshaleøen. It features approximately 50 stalls offering a diverse range of international cuisines. The venue is a popular destination for both locals and tourists, providing a lively atmosphere with food, drinks, and occasional events.

name: Brass Monkey
description: Brass Monkey is a vibrant bar located in the Vesterbro district of Copenhagen, known for its Hawaiian-themed cocktails with a volcanic flair. The bar offers a unique and lively atmosphere, perfect for enjoying creative drinks in a tropical setting.

name: Boutique Lize
description: Boutique Lize is a bar located in the vibrant Vesterbro district of Copenhagen. Known for its indie-rock soundtrack and date-friendly layout, it offers an eclectic selection of unusual tap beers. The bar provides a cozy and intimate atmosphere, making it a popular spot for both locals and visitors looking to enjoy a unique nightlife experience.

name: Mikkeller Bar & The Jane
description: Mikkeller Bar & The Jane are Copenhagen originals known for their craft beer and stylish mixed drinks, offering a unique experience in the vibrant Vesterbro district.

name: Jazzhouse
description: Historic jazz club now presenting rock, pop, electronic and indie showcases. Concert tickets can be bought on the premises from 18:30 on days when a concert is happening. Once the concerts are wrapped up, the nightclub opens, playing jazz-themed music through the night. It is usually very busy between 23:00 and midnight so be prepared to queue to get in.

location.name: Jazzhouse
location.address: Niels Hemmingsens Gade 10, City-center, 1129 Copenhagen, Denmark

name: Rust
description: Rust is a vibrant music venue located in the heart of Nørrebro, Copenhagen. Known for its eclectic mix of indie rock, hip hop, and electronica, Rust offers a long-running live-stage setting that attracts music enthusiasts from all over. The venue is committed to providing a safer space for all its patrons.

name: Culture Box
description: Culture Box is a renowned electronic-music venue in Copenhagen, known for its vibrant nightlife and top-notch DJ performances. It is considered a temple for electronic music enthusiasts, offering an immersive experience with its state-of-the-art sound system and dynamic lighting. The venue is open from Friday to Saturday, providing a perfect spot for weekend revelers.

name: Golden Days Festival
description: Golden Days Festival is Copenhagen's major annual culture festival, first held in 1994. It is a collaboration between over 100 cultural institutions in Copenhagen, aiming to share knowledge, history, and culture in an engaging way. The festival features thematic history celebrations with lectures and exhibitions, inviting locals and visitors to experience various historical periods, from Christian the 4’s Copenhagen to the industrial revolution and the interwar period. In 2024, the festival will explore the theme of working life, balancing past, future, part-time, overtime, and free time.

name: Kulturnatten (Culture Night)
description: Kulturnatten (Culture Night) is an annual event in Copenhagen and Frederiksberg, taking place on the Friday just before the Autumn Holiday in week 41. It offers a one-night open-house experience for over 200 cultural institutions, transforming the city into a vibrant cultural hub from 18:00 to 24:00.

name: Copenhagen Light Festival
description: Copenhagen Light Festival features illuminated sculptures and interactive light art installations across various locations in Copenhagen, including Refshaleøen, Ørestaden, Vestre Kirkegård, Nørrebro, the Lakes, and parts of the City.

name: Copenhagen Opera Festival
description: The Copenhagen Opera Festival is a city-wide celebration of opera, featuring performances in both indoor and outdoor venues across Copenhagen. Highlights include unique experiences such as canal tours with opera performances, offering a blend of traditional and innovative opera showcases.

name: Christmas in Tivoli
description: Christmas in Tivoli is a truly enjoyable Christmas experience that runs from 15 November 2024 to 5 January 2025. The gardens glow with thousands of sparkling lights, creating an authentic Christmas atmosphere. Visitors can greet Father Christmas, board the Santa Train, taste Christmas treats, and enjoy child-friendly rides. Adults can enjoy the romantic atmosphere, try ice skating, and explore Christmas stalls for unique gifts. Tivoli is the best place for Christmas traditions with loved ones.

name: Copenhagen Carnival
description: Copenhagen Carnival is a vibrant three-day festival held in Fælledparken, featuring colorful parades, multicultural food fairs, and performances showcasing the world's fantastic folk cultures. The event includes concerts, dance shows, and an open salsa dance floor, providing a lively atmosphere for all attendees.
